TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SyntaxNode extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a non-terminal node in the syntax tree. This is the language agnostic equivalent of and .

MemberSignature.Value: public T CopyAnnotationsTo<T> (T node) where T : Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode;
.method public hidebysig instance !!T CopyAnnotationsTo<(class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode) T>(!!T node) cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies all SyntaxAnnotations, if any, from this SyntaxNode instance and attaches them to a new instance based on .

remarks.para: If no annotations are copied, just returns .
It can also be used manually to preserve annotations in a more complex tree modification, even if the type of a node changes.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode FindNode (Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan span, bool findInsideTrivia = false, bool getInnermostNodeForTie = false);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode FindNode(valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan span, bool findInsideTrivia, bool getInnermostNodeForTie) cil managed

Docs.summary: Finds the node with the smallest that contains . is used to determine the behavior in case of a tie (i.e. a node having the same span as its parent). If is true, then it returns lowest descending node encompassing the given . Otherwise, it returns the outermost node encompassing the given .
Docs.remarks: TODO: This should probably be reimplemented with
Docs.exception: This exception is thrown if doesn't contain the given span.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken FindToken (int position, bool findInsideTrivia = false);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken FindToken(int32 position, bool findInsideTrivia) cil managed

Docs.param: The character position of the token relative to the beginning of the file.
True to return tokens that are part of trivia. If false finds the token whose full span (including trivia) includes the position.
Docs.summary: Finds a descendant token of this node whose span includes the supplied position.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken FindTokenCore (int position, Func<Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia,bool> stepInto);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken FindTokenCore(int32 position, class System.Func`2<valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia, bool> stepInto) cil managed

Docs.param: The character position of the token relative to the beginning of the file.
Applied on every structured trivia. Return false if the tokens included in the trivia should be skipped. Pass null to skip all structured trivia.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsEquivalentTo (Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode node, bool topLevel = false);
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsEquivalentTo(class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode node, bool topLevel) cil managed

Docs.param: If true then the nodes are equivalent if the contained nodes and tokens declaring metadata visible symbolic information are equivalent, ignoring any differences of nodes inside method bodies or initializer expressions, otherwise all nodes and tokens must be equivalent.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsMissing { get; }
.property instance bool IsMissing

Docs.summary: Determines whether the node represents a language construct that was actually parsed from the source code. Missing nodes are generated by the parser in error scenarios to represent constructs that should have been present in the source code in order to compile successfully but were actually missing.
